DataElement.preferredName: Microarray Variation Heatmap Grid Service Execution Control Programming Parameter Color Mapping Data Table Identifier Index java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.:An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.:A graphical representation of data where the values taken by a variable in a two-dimensional map are represented as colors.:A service available on a network infrastructure that coordinates resources that are not subject to central control, using open, general purpose protocols and interfaces to deliver nontrivial qualities of services.:The act of carrying out some order or instruction to accomplish an aim.:The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:A value that is passed to a routine._The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.:The creation of a two-dimensional graphic representation of an area or structure, showing the relative position of features or characteristics.:A set of data arranged in rows and columns.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.:A numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number; a number used to select an element of a list, vector, array or other sequence._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.:An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.:A graphical representation of data where the values taken by a variable in a two-dimensional map are represented as colors.:A service available on a system that coordinates resources that are not subject to central control, using open, general purpose protocols and interfaces to deliver nontrivial qualities of services.:The act of carrying out some order or instruction to accomplish an aim.:The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:A value that is passed to a routine.

Concepts.definition: A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.
An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.
A graphical representation of data where the values taken by a variable in a two-dimensional map are represented as colors.

A service available on a network infrastructure that coordinates resources that are not subject to central control, using open, general purpose protocols and interfaces to deliver nontrivial qualities of services.
The act of carrying out some order or instruction to accomplish an aim.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
A value that is passed to a routine.

Concepts.definition: The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.
